DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study evaluate histology histomorphometry , thirty human osseous biopsy sample fifteen patient ( 2 biopsy per patient ) follow 3 month implantation . This study part splitting-blind clinical investigation compare performance safety INION GTRTM Biodegradable Membrane System resorbable bilayer Bio-Gide®-membrane Geistlich biomaterials enhance bone regeneration removal wisdom teeth . The bone defect alveolar cavity augment Spongostan® dental 1x1x1cm , Johnson & Johnson , Spreitenbach , Switzerland . The extraction sit cover one side INION GTRTM Biodegradable Membrane System Geistlich resorbable bilayer Bio-Gide®-membrane . This study conduct adaptation ISO 10993 Standard : Biological Evaluation Medical Devices , Part 6 ( 2007 ) : Tests Local Effects Implantation . DOC.brief_title: A Split-Blind Clinical Investigation Compare Performance Safety Inion GTR™ Biodegradable Membrane System Resorbable Bilayer Bio-Gide®-Membrane Geistlich Biomaterials Enhancing Bone Regeneration After Removal Wisdom Teeth .
DOC.criteria: Inclusion criterion : Females male age 18 30 Subject extraction lower fully impacted wisdom teeth Signed informed consent Able willing comply study procedure Exclusion criterion : Heavy smoker ( > 20/day ) Insulin dependant diabetes Pregnant nursing
